moves.1. e4 c5: The Sicilian Defense. I don't like this opening, because it has too much defense. I like more open games, preferably the Scottish. Anyhow, I always play the same way against opponents that play this.
moves.2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6 5. Bd3: Bd3, and not Nc3. I don't like that later, Black's knight can go to Ne5, then Nc4. I protect that, and start up a new game.
moves.5... Nc6 6. Be3: Be3, followed up by c3, and Nd2. I get a great center.
moves.6... e5: Not exactly the best. Preferably Ng4 for black here, attacking the bishop, and forcing my queen to go to Qe2.
moves.8. O-O Be7 9. Nc3: Here I chose to play Nc3 instead of c3, because my f3 knight isn't on d4, and c3 would be very irrelevant.
moves.9... h6: Not sure why he played this. No way I'm going for the pin, since there isn't a pin. His bishop is there.
moves.14... Rb8 15. Nd5: Sending my knight in the center.
moves.17. Bxd4 exd4 18. Qe4: Threatening Qh7 mate. However, my opponent was more into the pawn to notice the mate.
moves.19. Qh7#: Easily checkmated him. That's why I think you should look around, and not focused on the pawns instead of checkmates. Thanks for watching!!
